intro: Rosa orbicans subsp. villi-orbicans, commonly known as the alpine rose, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, thorny stems. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to red, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five to seven oval-shaped leaflets, and are covered in a fine, silvery down. This subspecies is adapted to harsh alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
